billing_address.description: The payer's billing address.

birth_date.description: The birth date of the payer, in Internet date format. For example, 1990-04-12.

country_code.description: The payer's two-character IS0-3166-1 country code.

email.description: The payer's email address. Maximum length is 127 characters.

phone.description: The payer's phone number. Maximum length is 20 characters.

phone_type.description: The phone type. Possible values: HOME, WORK, MOBILE, OTHER.

shipping_address.description: [DEPRECATED] The shipping address. Use the shipping address for the purchase unit or at the root level of the checkout session.

tax_id.description: The payer's tax ID. Supported for the PayPal payment method only.Maximum length: 14.

tax_id_type.description: The payer's tax ID type. Supported for the PayPal payment method only. Possible values: BR_CPF, BR_CNPJ.

currency.description: The three-character ISO-4217 currency code. PayPal does not support all currencies.

value.description: The amount. Includes the specified number of digits after decimal separator for the ISO-4217 currency code

amount.description: The amount to capture. If the amount matches the originally authorized amount, the state of the authorization changes to captured. Otherwise, the state of the authorization changes to partially_captured.

invoice_number.description: The invoice number to track this payment.

is_final_capture.description: Indicates whether to release all remaining funds that the authorization holds in the funding instrument (FI). Default is false.

note_to_payer.description: free-form field that clients can use to send a note to the payer.

transaction_fee.description: The currency and amount of the transaction fee for this payment.

funding_instruments.description: An array of a single funding instrument for the current payment. Valid only and required for the credit card payment method. The array must include either a credit_card or credit_card_token object. If the array contains more than one instrument, the payment is declined.

payer_info.description: The payer-related information. If the payment_method is paypal, you must set the email address of the PayPal account that funds the transaction in the payer_info.

payment_method.description: TheThe payment method. Value is PayPal Wallet payment, bank direct debit, or direct credit card.

status.description: The status of payer's PayPal account.

custom.description: A free-form field for the client's use. Maximum length: 127.

description.description: The description of the purchase. Maximum length: 127.

invoice_number.description: The invoice number to track this payment. Maximum length: 127.

item_list.description: An array of items that are being purchased.

note_to_payee.description: Optional. A note to the recipient of the funds in this transaction. Maximum length: 255.

notify_url.description: The URL to send payment notifications. Maximum length: 2048.

order_url.description: The URL on the merchant site related to this payment. Maximum length: 2048.

payee.description: The recipient of the funds in this transaction.

payment_options.description: The payment options requested for this transaction.

purchase_order.description: The purchase order number or ID. Identifies this payment. Maximum length: 127.

reference_id.description: Optional. The merchant-provided ID for the purchase unit. Maximum length: 256.

related_resources.description: An array of payment-related transactions. A transaction defines what the payment is for and who fulfills the payment.

soft_descriptor.description: The soft descriptor that is used when charging this funding source. Maximum length is 22 characters. If you include a value that is greater than 22 characters, the API truncates the string. Maximum length: 22.

custom.description: A free-form field for the client's use. Maximum length: 127.

description.description: The description of the purchase. Maximum length: 127.

invoice_number.description: The invoice number to track this payment. Maximum length: 127.

item_list.description: An array of items that are being purchased.

note_to_payee.description: Optional. A note to the recipient of the funds in this transaction. Maximum length: 255.

notify_url.description: The URL to send payment notifications. Maximum length: 2048.

order_url.description: The URL on the merchant site related to this payment. Maximum length: 2048.

payee.description: The recipient of the funds in this transaction.

payment_options.description: The payment options requested for this transaction.

purchase_order.description: The purchase order number or ID. Identifies this payment. Maximum length: 127.

reference_id.description: Optional. The merchant-provided ID for the purchase unit. Maximum length: 256.

related_resources.description: An array of payment-related transactions. A transaction defines what the payment is for and who fulfills the payment.

soft_descriptor.description: The soft descriptor that is used when charging this funding source. Maximum length is 22 characters. If you include a value that is greater than 22 characters, the API truncates the string. Maximum length: 22.

currency.description: The three-character ISO-4217 currency code. PayPal does not support all currencies.

details.description: The additional details about the payment amount.

total.description: The total amount charged to the payee by the payer. For refunds, represents the amount that the payee refunds to the original payer. Maximum length is 10 characters, which includes: Seven digits before the decimal point. The decimal point. Two digits after the decimal point.

amount.description: The amount to capture. If the amount matches the originally authorized amount, the state of the authorization changes to captured. Otherwise, the state of the authorization changes to partially_captured.

create_time.description: The date and time when the capture occurred, in Internet date and time format as defined in RFC 3339 Section 5.6.

id.description: The ID of the capture transaction.

invoice_number.description: The invoice number to track this payment. Maximum length: 127.

is_final_capture.description: Indicates whether to release all remaining funds that the authorization holds in the funding instrument (FI). Default is false.

links.description: An array of request-related HATEOAS links.

parent_payment.description: The ID of the payment on which this transaction is based.

reason_code.description: An array of request-related HATEOAS links.

state.description: The capture state. Value is: pending. The capture is pending. completed. The capture has successfully completed. refunded. The capture was fully refunded. partially_refunded. The capture was partially refunded. Possible values: pending, completed, refunded, partially_refunded.

transaction_fee.description: The transaction fee for this payment.

update_time.description: The date and time when the capture occurred, in Internet date and time format as defined in RFC 3339 Section 5.6.

href.description: The complete target URL. To make the related call, combine the method with this link, in URI template format. Include the $, (, and ) characters for pre-processing. The href is the key HATEOAS component that links a completed call with a subsequent call.

method.description: The HTTP method required to make the related call. Possible values: GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, HEAD, CONNECT, OPTIONS, PATCH.

Possible values: CHARGEBACK, GUARANTEE, BUYER_COMPLAINT, REFUND, UNCONFIRMED_SHIPPING_ADDRES,ECHECK, INTERNATIONAL_WITHDRAWAL, RECEIVING_PREFERENCE_MANDATES_MANUAL_ACTION, PAYMENT_REVIE, REGULATORY_REVIEW, UNILATERAL, VERIFICATION_REQUIRED, TRANSACTION_APPROVED_AWAITING_FUNDING.

receipt_id.description: The receipt ID, which is a payment ID number that is returned for guest users to identify the payment.

receivable_amount.description: The net amount that the merchant receives for this transaction in their receivable currency. Returned only in cross-currency use cases where a merchant bills a buyer in a non-primary currency for that buyer.

state.description: The sale transaction state. Possible values: completed, partially_refunded, pending, refunded, denied.

protection_eligibility.description: The level of seller protection in effect for the transaction.Possible values: ELIGIBLE, PARTIALLY_ELIGIBLE, INELIGIBLE.

UNAUTHORIZED_PAYMENT_ELIGIBLE. Sellers are protected against claims for unauthorized payments. reference_id.description: The ID of the purchase unit that is associated with this object. Obsolete. Used only in cart_base.

state.description: The order transaction state. Value is: pending. The order was created but no authorizations/captures were made against the order. authorized. The order has only been authorized. No capture was made against the order. captured. The order has at least one capture initiated. completed. The order is complete as a capture was made against the order with is_final_capture set to TRUE. No more authorizations/captures can be made against this order. voided. The order was voided. No more authorizations/captures can be made against this order. Possible values: pending, authorized, captured, completed, voided.

For more information, see Fraud Management Filters Summary.

Merchant is protected by PayPal's Seller Protection Policy for Unauthorized Payments and Item Not Received. PARTIALLY_ELIGIBLE. Merchant is protected by PayPal's Seller Protection Policy for Item Not Received or Unauthorized Payments. For details, see protection_eligibility_type. INELIGIBLE. Merchant is not protected under the Seller Protection Policy.

line1.description: The first line of the address. For example, number, street, and so on.

phone.description: A phone number. Must be represented in its canonical international format, as defined by the E.164 numbering plan.

postal_code.description: The postal code, which is the zip code or equivalent. Typically required for countries with postal codes. For countries that have postal codes or an equivalent, see Postal code.

state.description: The two-character ISO 3166-1 code that identifies the country or region. Note: The country code for Great Britain is GB and not UK as is used in that country's top-level domain names. Use the C2 country code for CHINA WORLDWIDE (for CUP, bank card, and cross-border transactions).

status.description: The address status. Possible values: CONFIRMED, UNCONFIRMED

type.description: The type of address. For example, HOME_OR_WORK, GIFT, and so on.

The array must include either a credit_card or credit_card_token object. If the array contains more than one instrument, the payment is declined.

payer_info.description: The payer-related information. If the payment_method is paypal, you must set the email address of the PayPal account that funds the transaction in the payer_info.

payment_method.description: TheThe payment method. Value is PayPal Wallet payment, bank direct debit, or direct credit card.

status.description: The status of payer's PayPal account.

brand_name.description: A label that overrides the business name in the merchant's PayPal account on the PayPal checkout pages.

landing_page.description: The type of landing page to show on the PayPal site for customer checkout.

locale.description: The locale of pages that the PayPal payment experience displays

user_action.description: The user action. Presents the customer with either the Continue or Pay Now checkout flow

email.description: The email address associated with the payee's PayPal account. If the provided email address is not associated with any PayPal account, the payee can only receive PayPal Wallet payments. Direct credit card payments are denied due to card compliance requirements.

merchant_id.description: The encrypted PayPal account ID for the payee.

payee_display_metadata.description: Payee metadata references display only metadata for the Payee

rel.description: The link relation type, which serves as an ID for a link that unambiguously describes the semantics of the link. See Link Relations.

payment_hold_reasons.description: An array of reasons that PayPal holds the recipient fund. Set only if the payment hold status is HELD.

payment_hold_status.description: The recipient fund status. Returned only when the fund status is held. Possible values: HELD.

payment_mode.description: The transaction payment mode. Supported only when payment_method is paypal. Possible values: INSTANT_TRANSFER, MANUAL_BANK_TRANSFER, DELAYED_TRANSFER, ECHECK.

protection_eligibility.description: The seller protection level in effect for the transaction. Supported only when the payment_method is paypal. Possible values: ELIGIBLE, PARTIALLY_ELIGIBLE, INELIGIBLE.

protection_eligibility_type.description: The seller protection type in effect for the transaction. Returned only when protection_eligibility is ELIGIBLE or PARTIALLY_ELIGIBLE. Supported only when the payment_method is paypal. Possible values: ITEM_NOT_RECEIVED_ELIGIBLE, UNAUTHORIZED_PAYMENT_ELIGIBLE,ITEM_NOT_RECEIVED_ELIGIBLE,UNAUTHORIZED_PAYMENT_ELIGIBLE.

purchase_unit_reference_id.description: The ID of the transaction that corresponds to this sale transaction.

reason_code.description: A reason code that describes why the transaction state is pending or reversed. Supported only when the payment_method is paypal. Possible values: CHARGEBACK, GUARANTEE, BUYER_COMPLAINT, REFUND, UNCONFIRMED_SHIPPING_ADDRES,ECHECK, INTERNATIONAL_WITHDRAWAL, RECEIVING_PREFERENCE_MANDATES_MANUAL_ACTION, PAYMENT_REVIE, REGULATORY_REVIEW, UNILATERAL, VERIFICATION_REQUIRED, TRANSACTION_APPROVED_AWAITING_FUNDING.

receipt_id.description: The receipt ID, which is a payment ID number that is returned for guest users to identify the payment.

receivable_amount.description: The net amount that the merchant receives for this transaction in their receivable currency. Returned only in cross-currency use cases where a merchant bills a buyer in a non-primary currency for that buyer.

state.description: The sale transaction state. Possible values: completed, partially_refunded, pending, refunded, denied.

update_time.description: The date and time when the resource was last updated, in Internet date and time format.

billing_address.description: The payer's billing address.

birth_date.description: The birth date of the payer, in Internet date format. For example, 1990-04-12.

country_code.description: The payer's two-character IS0-3166-1 country code.

email.description: The payer's email address. Maximum length is 127 characters.

phone.description: The payer's phone number. Maximum length is 20 characters.

phone_type.description: The phone type. Possible values: HOME, WORK, MOBILE, OTHER.

shipping_address.description: [DEPRECATED] The shipping address. Use the shipping address for the purchase unit or at the root level of the checkout session.

tax_id.description: The payer's tax ID. Supported for the PayPal payment method only.Maximum length: 14.

tax_id_type.description: The payer's tax ID type. Supported for the PayPal payment method only. Possible values: BR_CPF, BR_CNPJ.

currency.description: The three-character ISO-4217 currency code.

description.description: The item description. Supported only for the PayPal payment method. Maximum length: 127.

name.description: The item name. Maximum length is 127 characters.

price.description: The item cost. Maximum length is 10 characters.

quantity.description: The item quantity. Maximum length is 10 characters.

sku.description: The stock keeping unit (SKU) for the item. Maximum length: 127.

tax.description: The item tax. Supported only for the PayPal payment method.

url.description: The URL to item information. Available to the payer in the transaction history.

amount.description: The refund amount. Includes both the amount refunded to the payer and the fee refunded to the payee.

capture_id.description: The ID of the sale transaction being refunded.

create_time.description: The date and time when the refund was created, in Internet date and time format.

description.description: The refund description.

id.description: The ID of the refund transaction. Maximum length: 17

invoice_number.description: Your own invoice or tracking ID number. Value is a string of single-byte alphanumeric characters. Maximum length: 127.

links.description: An array of request-related HATEOAS links.

parent_payment.description: The ID of the payment on which this transaction is based.

reason.description: The reason that the transaction is being refunded.

sale_id.description: The ID of the sale transaction being refunded.

state.description: The state of the refund. Possible values: pending, completed, cancelled, failed.

update_time.description: The date and time when the resource was last updated, in Internet date and time format.

billing_address.description: The billing address associated with this card.

cvv2.description: The three- to four-digit card validation code

expire_month.description: The expiration month with no leading zero. Value is from 1 to 12.

links.description: An array of request-related HATEOAS links

number.description: The credit card number. Value is numeric characters only with no spaces or punctuation. Must conform to the modulo and length required by each credit card type. Redacted in responses.

type.description: The credit card type. Value is visa, mastercard, discover, or amex

credit_card.description: Deprecated. The credit card details. You can use this instrument to fund a payment. Use a payment card instead

credit_card_token.description: The PayPal vaulted credit card instrument.

amount.description: The amount to capture. If the amount matches the originally authorized amount, the state of the authorization changes to captured. Otherwise, the state of the authorization changes to partially_captured.

create_time.description: The date and time when the capture occurred, in Internet date and time format as defined in RFC 3339 Section 5.6.

id.description: The ID of the capture transaction.

invoice_number.description: The invoice number to track this payment. Maximum length: 127.

is_final_capture.description: Indicates whether to release all remaining funds that the authorization holds in the funding instrument (FI). Default is false.

links.description: An array of request-related HATEOAS links.

parent_payment.description: The ID of the payment on which this transaction is based.

reason_code.description: An array of request-related HATEOAS links.

state.description: The capture state. Value is: pending. The capture is pending. completed. The capture has successfully completed. refunded. The capture was fully refunded. partially_refunded. The capture was partially refunded. Possible values: pending, completed, refunded, partially_refunded.

transaction_fee.description: The transaction fee for this payment.

update_time.description: The date and time when the capture occurred, in Internet date and time format as defined in RFC 3339 Section 5.6.

funding_instruments.description: An array of a single funding instrument for the current payment. Valid only and required for the credit card payment method. The array must include either a credit_card or credit_card_token object. If the array contains more than one instrument, the payment is declined.

payer_info.description: The payer-related information. If the payment_method is paypal, you must set the email address of the PayPal account that funds the transaction in the payer_info.

payment_method.description: TheThe payment method. Value is PayPal Wallet payment, bank direct debit, or direct credit card.

status.description: The status of payer's PayPal account.

application_context.description: Use the application context resource to customize payment flow experience for your buyers.

create_time.description: The date and time when the payment was created, in Internet date and time format.

experience_profile_id.description: The PayPal-generated ID for the merchant's payment experience profile. For information, see create web experience profile.

failure_reason.description: The reason code for a payment failure.

id.description: The ID of the payment.

intent.description: The payment intent. Value is: sale. Makes an immediate payment. authorize. Authorizes a payment for capture later. order. Creates an order.

links.description: An array of request-related HATEOAS links.

note_to_payer.description: A free-form field that clients can use to send a note to the payer. Maximum length: 165.

payer.description: The source of the funds for this payment. Payment method is PayPal Wallet payment or bank direct debit.

redirect_urls.description: A set of redirect URLs that you provide for PayPal-based payments.

state.description: The state of the payment, authorization, or order transaction. Value is: created. The transaction was successfully created. approved. The buyer approved the transaction. failed. The transaction request failed. Possible values: created, approved, failed.

transactions.description: An array of payment-related transactions. A transaction defines what the payment is for and who fulfills the payment. For update and execute payment calls, the transactions object accepts the amount object only.

update_time.description: The date and time when the payment was updated, in Internet date and time format.

href.description: The complete target URL. To make the related call, combine the method with this link, in URI template format. Include the $, (, and ) characters for pre-processing. The href is the key HATEOAS component that links a completed call with a subsequent call.

method.description: The HTTP method required to make the related call. Possible values: GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, HEAD, CONNECT, OPTIONS, PATCH.

rel.description: The link relation type, which serves as an ID for a link that unambiguously describes the semantics of the link. See Link Relations.

href.description: The complete target URL. To make the related call, combine the method with this link, in URI template format. Include the $, (, and ) characters for pre-processing. The href is the key HATEOAS component that links a completed call with a subsequent call.

method.description: The HTTP method required to make the related call. Possible values: GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, HEAD, CONNECT, OPTIONS, PATCH.

rel.description: The link relation type, which serves as an ID for a link that unambiguously describes the semantics of the link. See Link Relations.

advice_code.description: The merchant advice on how to handle declines for recurring payments. Possible values: 01_NEW_ACCOUNT_INFORMATION, 02_TRY_AGAIN_LATER, 02_STOP_SPECIFIC_PAYMENT, 03_DO_NOT_TRY_AGAIN, 03_REVOKE_AUTHORIZATION_FOR_FUTURE_PAYMENT, 21_DO_NOT_TRY_AGAIN_CARD_HOLDER_CANCELLED_RECURRRING_CHARGE, 21_CANCEL_ALL_RECURRING_PAYMENTS.

avs_code.description: The Address Verification System (AVS) response code.Maximum length: 1. Pattern: [A-z0-9]{1}.

cvv_code.description: The CVV system response code. Maximum length: 1. Pattern: [A-z0-9]{1}.

response_code.description: The PayPal normalized response code, which is generated from the processor's specific response code. Maximum length: 4

vpas.description: The processor-provided Visa Payer Authentication Service status.

ordersPostReq.description: A payment. Use this object to create, process, and manage payments.

application_context.description: Use the application context resource to customize payment flow experience for your buyers.

experience_profile_id.description: The PayPal-generated ID for the merchant''s payment experience profile. For information, see create web experience profile.

intent.description: order. Creates an order. Possible values: order.

note_to_payer.description: A free-form field that clients can use to send a note to the payer.

payer.description: The source of the funds for this payment. Payment method is PayPal Wallet payment or bank direct debit.

redirect_urls.description: A set of redirect URLs that you provide for PayPal-based payments.
redirect_urls.x-conditionally-required-description: This field required when payment_method is 'paypal'
